Articles.Content:
Ive been having a mess around with career mode, and though i find that the science system isn't perfect (even when you completely avoid using comms to transmit science), i thought of a way to make it more interesting, and allow more science to be produced from missions, whilst keeping it balanced, and making it profitable to use ridiculous launcher stages and massive landers.

all science data in the game has a data size attribute already, currently only used for transmittal statistics, but why not allow experiment data to be stored in parts other than the actual experiment part? for example, you could conduct your experiments, then transfer the data to a data storage module (likely the size of the jr. science module) or very small radial units so that the experiment can be reset (based on the forthcoming logic) and somewhat repeated.

in order to keep the balance, the idea of a flash drive that could hold a whole mission worth of data is well out the window, but if the data capacity was rather small (ie. radial units could only store small experiment data (5 Mits or so)) and the parts were relativley heavy (into the realms of the mystery goo containers, and possibly even stupidly heavy hard drive core modules (similar size to the materials lab) that would take a real manly engine and launcher to haul up to orbit and beyond

and it also gives the player incentive to develop high powered launcher and tug stages, since currently a vessel capable of carrying all your experiments to the far reaches of the solar system can be achieved in one launch with only 3 R+D nodes of rocketry development (up to and including the fuel lines), but an incentive for a stupidly powerful launcher, capable of launching a titanic hard drive module could push the boundaries of the community's insane rockets division even further

just an idea, and im sure that people can find some ways to develop it further
